definition: self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa
those on our side/ourselves/one's own people/one of us
to crush one's own foot while trying to maneuver a rock (to a cliff edge, to drop on one's enemy) (idiom)/hoisted by one's own petard
pinyin: ban1 qi3 shi2 tou5 za2 zi4 ji3 de5 jiao3

definition: to move a stone and stub one's toe/to shoot oneself in the foot (idiom)
pinyin: ban1 shi2 tou5 za2 zi4 ji3 de5 jiao3

definition: to do (sth) oneself/to help oneself to
Help others, and others may help you (idiom).
pinyin: yu3 ren2 fang1 bian4 , zi4 ji3 fang1 bian4

definition: Go your own way, let others say what they like. (popular modern cliche)/Do it my way.
pinyin: zou3 zi4 ji3 de5 lu4 , rang4 ren2 jia1 qu4 shuo1
containing_words.word: 走自己的路，讓人家去說

pinyin: jin1 wo1 yin2 wo1 bu4 ru2 zi4 ji3 de5 gou3 wo1
containing_words.word: 金窩銀窩不如自己的狗窩

sentences.english: Further Practice for Pairs ·Add a third speaker and create your own lines.
sentences.chinese: 加進圈外人，創作你們自己的對話。

sentences.english: To me, in the love of the river, I often feel like I was upstream .
sentences.chinese: 於我，在愛情的河流裏，我經常覺得自己在逆流而上。

sentences.english: The pity of it is that an intelligent man appears to have been seduced by the sound of his own voice.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是，這位智者似乎被自己的聲音誤導了。

sentences.english: And so Sarai took it upon herself to solve God’s problem.
sentences.chinese: 撒萊在自己解決神的問題。

sentences.english: While it was a great day, I got a bit sunburned in the water.
sentences.chinese: 今天過得很棒，但我在水裏把自己給曬傷了。

sentences.english: Encourage her release by constructing an erotic fantasy before things heat up.
sentences.chinese: 應當在高潮激發前鼓勵她通過性幻想放鬆自己。

sentences.english: He felt browned off when he heard that he waw dismissed.
sentences.chinese: 當他聽到自己被解職時感到很不痛快。

sentences.english: Iclear own this do not have the ability robel.
sentences.chinese: 我自己清楚自己更本沒有能力逆天。

sentences.english: Iclear own this do not have the ability robel.
sentences.chinese: 我自己清楚自己更本沒有能力逆天。

sentences.english: The insect found itself entangled in an inextricable net.
sentences.chinese: 昆蟲發現自己被纏在一個逃脫不掉的羅網中。

sentences.english: When you’re a kid, you cannot go anywhere by yourself.
sentences.chinese: 當你是一個孩子的時候，你不能自己去任何地方。

sentences.english: Should one renounce Nirvana oneself, in order to help others towards it first?
sentences.chinese: 人應該放棄自己的涅磐，爲了首先幫助它人達到它？

sentences.english: So you testify against yourselves that you are the descendants of those who murdered the prophets.
sentences.chinese: 這就是你們自己證明，是殺害先知者的子孫了。

sentences.english: It seems unfair. Except at the margins, there isn't much we can do about physical attractiveness.
sentences.chinese: 似乎老天不太公平，我們不太能改變自己的長相。

sentences.english: Without experiences in mind, he pledged he would never let his own two-year old son face such difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 他發誓不會讓自己兩歲的兒子生活得那麼艱辛。

sentences.english: In this way,we can develop ourselves in different aspects.
sentences.chinese: 這樣我們就可以在不同的方面發展自己。

definition: he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
to watch from a height or distance/to survey
you (informal, as opposed to courteous 您[nin2])
